text.p: Philippine holding firm Asia Amalgamated Holdings Inc A shares rose by 0.50 centavos, or 9.0 percent, to six centavos on a newspaper report its unit Ecology Savings Bank forecasts good earnings for 1996, brokers said.
"The reason why its up is that Ecology Savings Bank seems to be doing well," said Joey Roxas, president at Eagle Securities Inc.

A newspaper report quoted Ecology Savings president Ramon Militar as saying he expected a 12 million peso net income for the bank in 1996. He said in the first six months of its operations last year, the bank had received 700 million pesos in deposits.
Officials from Asia Amalgamated and the bank were not immediately available for comment.
A total of 21.8 million Asia Amalgamated shares changed hands late in the session while some 100,000 B shares were traded.
Asia Amalagamated B shares rose by 1.25 centavos, or 20.83 percent, to 7.25 centavos in late trade.
Asia Amalgamated is the financial services company of the Gow family, franchise holders of Uniwide Sales, a chain of warehouse-type supermarkets and department stores in Manila.
